==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=小确幸}}

===Etymology===
Borrowed from the {{etyl|ja|zh}} ''[[w:en:Wasei Kango|wasei kango]]'' ({{lang|ja|和製漢語}}, Japanese-made Chinese words) term {{m|ja|小確幸|tr=shōgakkō}}, from {{m|ja|小|tr=shō||little}} + {{m|ja|確|tr=kaku||sure}} + {{m|ja|幸|tr=kō||fortune}}, which was first used by Japanese writer [[w:Haruki Murakami|Haruki Murakami]] in ''Afternoon in the Islets of Langerhans'' ({{lang|ja|ランゲルハンス島の午後}}, 1986).
